intro: Alaticaulia dorisiae, commonly known as the Dorisia alate-stemmed plant, is a unique species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, flattened, winged stems that contribute to its common name. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or montane regions. Its leaves are usually small,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a compact rosette pattern. Alaticaulia dorisiae is of interest to botanists due to its specialized morphology and limited distribution.
